content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
NEUTRAL — normal volatility (Vol: 26.4%) but extremely narrow participation (Breadth: 0/8), signalling a fragile market with limited upside conviction.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Relative leaders: Heavy Industry and Technology (least negative this week) — Heavy Industry showing resilience around select autos/defense; Technology propped by TTKOM and KONTR prior runs.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Largest drags: Transportation and Holding & Investment, followed by Banking and Energy & Chemicals — Transportation underperformed sharply on TAVHL/airlines weakness.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
TRMET (1W: +8.31% | 1M: +17.39%) ABOVE TREND; TRALT (1W: +2.81% | 1M: +12.07%) ABOVE TREND; ASELS (1W: +1.82% | 1M: +1.24%) ABOVE TREND; TTKOM (1W: +0.94% | 1M: +10.87%) ABOVE TREND; SOKM (1W: +0.90% | 1M: +13.34%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
DOHOL (1W: -7.98% | 1M: +1.40%) CORRECTION; ARCLK (1W: -8.00% | 1M: +9.82%) CORRECTION; VESTL (1W: -8.03% | 1M: +2.04%) CORRECTION; SISE (1W: -8.57% | 1M: +15.05%) CORRECTION; OYAKC (1W: -8.67% | 1M: -5.04%) BELOW TREND.

6. Momentum Stocks?
Strongest 1W moves: TRMET (1W: +8.31% | 1M: +17.39%) ABOVE TREND; TAVHL (1W: -10.22% | 1M: +1.97%) CORRECTION; PETKM (1W: -9.53% | 1M: +1.76%) CORRECTION; KONTR (1W: -9.05% | 1M: +4.15%) CORRECTION; ULKER (1W: -8.99% | 1M: +0.88%) CORRECTION.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Broad pullback across banks; AKBNK (1W: -4.55% | 1M: +8.89%) CORRECTION, GARAN (1W: -4.96% | 1M: +2.78%) CORRECTION, ISCTR (1W: -9.26% | 1M: +10.76%) CORRECTION, VAKBN (1W: -0.97% | 1M: +17.70%) CORRECTION — watch earnings/asset quality headlines for volatility.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Mixed within heavy industry: TOASO (1W: +0.08% | 1M: +15.95%) ABOVE TREND and ASELS (1W: +1.82% | 1M: +1.24%) ABOVE TREND are relative leaders while ARCLK (1W: -8.00% | 1M: +9.82%) CORRECTION and VESTL (1W: -8.03% | 1M: +2.04%) CORRECTION are clear laggards.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Rotation and profit-taking dominate: TRMET (1W: +8.31% | 1M: +17.39%) ABOVE TREND and TRALT (1W: +2.81% | 1M: +12.07%) ABOVE TREND up, while TUPRS (1W: -0.81% | 1M: +0.18%) CORRECTION, PETKM (1W: -9.53% | 1M: +1.76%) CORRECTION and OYAKC (1W: -8.67% | 1M: -5.04%) BELOW TREND lag.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Maintain neutral weights; trim high-beta/largest laggards (transportation, select holding names) and favor high-quant defensive longs (ENKAI, SOKM, MGROS, BIMAS, VAKBN) and select industrials with confirmed above-trend status.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
TRMET (1W: +8.31% | 1M: +17.39%) ABOVE TREND; TAVHL (1W: -10.22% | 1M: +1.97%) CORRECTION; ISCTR (1W: -9.26% | 1M: +10.76%) CORRECTION; TOASO (1W: +0.08% | 1M: +15.95%) ABOVE TREND.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Transportation for continued volatility; Energy & Chemicals for rotational follow-through; Retail & Food for defensive flows and quant-driven buying.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Watch XU100 short-term technical pivots (hold near the recent 1-month lows; break below = defensive reweight, reclaiming the monthly high = risk-on re-entry). Catalysts: CBRT commentary and FX moves, US macro (CPI/PMI), bank and energy earnings, and any company-specific operational updates.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Neutral volatility environment but breadth is alarmingly weak (0/8 sectors positive), suggesting risk is concentrated and sentiment fragile; favor high-quant defensive names and selective above-trend industrials while trimming transportation and weak holding/energy names ahead of macro and earnings catalysts.
